intro: Stenostephanus longistaminus, commonly known as the long-stamen stephanus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Its long, slender stamens are a distinctive botanical feature, giving it its scientific name. While not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
